TopicTitle: 0.90 32bit KPS Doesn't load the game. 64bit did but is no longer in my files. May I have it back???

Articles.Content:
Hi folks,

Since the 0.90 version i wasn't able to play the game in 32bit mode because the problem with memory usage. It wasn't a problem for me because the 64bit version of the game was working absoluterly fine.

Unfortunately now i found out that ALL the 64bit data and EXE has been removed from my game (steam version, integrity cache ok) and so I am NO longer able to play the game at all !!!! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif):mad:![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

Is there any way i can have back my 64bit version??? This would solve my problem in a splitsecond because i never had any problem with that version!!!!

Is very frustating to be forced to renounce to some part of the game when before the 64bit cancellation everything was working absolutely smoothly!!!
i too am experiancing these dificulties and would like the 64bit version back
Squad removed it in preparation for 1.0. They are no longer supporting 64bit windows because for most ppl it was incredibly unstable. It is gone for the foreseeable future.

And this is why you should by from there site as they arnt smart enough to update it.

p.S. steam is s\*\*\*

> p.S. steam is s\*\*\*

Keep two copies. Steam is awesome BTW.
Install Ubuntu 14.04 linux, 64 bit runs fine on it. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) just need a small partition

> 
> Install Ubuntu 14.04 linux, 64 bit runs fine on it. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) just need a small partition

I'm half tempted to design a thumb drive distro to put KSP on. 

I'd use a dedicated partition or loopbackfs instead of the traditional casper, so that it can actually have full read-write function of everything. I may add a writethrough RAMDISK copy, though to improve performance on high-RAM systems.
I have a high ram system, i'd be very interested in that
Can someone who still has it stash the 64-bit executable somewhere please? This is ridiculous.
